Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to understand the normative rules and the desiderata provided The user wants me to check three cases 1 2 3 and see which ones break the strict rules normative and which just dont meet the best practices desiderata

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Starting with Part 1 Normative Process Behavior The key here is the strict sequence The process must follow the order Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant if approved then Finalize Docs before closing Close Case Also if rejected you cant finalize docs before closing

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Let me look at Case 1 first The log shows the steps in order Application Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Finalize Docs Close That seems to follow all the steps in the right order The approved path includes Finalizing Docs before closing which is correct So Case 1 looks okay with the normative rules

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Moving to Case 2 The first few steps Application received then immediately Risk Assessment at 0820 but before that the Credit Check was supposed to be next after Application Here Credit Check happened after Risk Assessment which violates the ordering rule because Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Thats a normative violation

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then the Loan Decision was Rejected but after that they did Finalize Documentation which is not allowed if rejected The normative rules state that Finalize Docs should only be done if approved and closing should happen without it if rejected So thats another violation here

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Wait but the Inform Applicant step is it missing Wait let me check the table again Looking at the log for Case 2 the next activity after Loan Decision is Finalize Docs Wait the tables entry for Case 2 after Loan Decision 930 the next activity is Finalize Docs at 1000 So they skipped the Inform Applicant step Wait thats a problem Wait the normative rule says that Inform Applicant must occur after Loan Decision So if they skipped Inform thats a violation of the normative rules

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Therefore Case 2 has three violations 1 Risk Assessment before Credit Check order violation 2 Finalize Docs after rejection prohibited 3 Missing Inform Applicant since its required after Loan Decision which wasnt done

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 Lets see The Application is received on the 12th then Credit Check is on the 14th The normative rules dont have a time constraint here only the order The order here is correct Application Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Approved Inform Finalize Close So the sequence is okay The Loan Decision was Approved so they finalized docs before closing which is okay So normative is okay

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now moving to part 2 desiderata violations Wait the desiderata are three things 1 Credit Check within 24 hours after application 2 Inform Applicant within 48 hours of Loan Decision 3 Perform Follow up Call before closing but its optional just recommended

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 1 Credit Check was 30 minutes after application good Inform was at 1300 Loan Decision at 1100 same day so within 48 hours No Follow up Call so thats a desideratum

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2 The normative violations are the main issue here The desiderata for them Credit Check after the application was delayed The Credit Check was done at 0900 but since the Risk Assessment was done first the order is wrong But for the timing of Credit Check after application in Case 2 the application was at 0800 and Credit Check was at 0900 which is within 24 hours So the timing is okay for Credit Check The Inform step Wait since they didnt do the Inform step thats also a normative violation but the desideratums timing is about when they do it Since they didnt do it the timing doesnt apply but the normative violation is more severe No Follow up Call is a desideratum

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 3 Desiderata for Case 3 Credit Check was done on 14th at 1000 AM The application was on the 12th at 900 AM The time between Application and Credit Check is over two days so thats more than 24 hours So thats a desideratum violation The Inform Applicant was done on the 16th at 1500 The Loan Decision was on the 14th at 1200 So from Decision at 1200 on the 14th to Inform at 16th 1500 is two days and three hours which is over 48 hours So thats a desideratum violation took longer than 48 hours Also no Follow up Call which is another desideratum

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So summarizing Normative violations Case 1 None Case 2 Multiple violations Risk Assessment before Credit Check order violation Finalize Docs after rejection prohibited action Missing Inform Applicant violates the rule that Inform must occur after Loan Decision Case 3 No normative violations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Desiderata violations Case 1 Desiderata violations missing Follow up Call Case 2 Desiderata violations no Follow up Call Also the Credit Check was on time within 24h but the missing Inform step is a normative issue not desideratum Case 3 Credit Check took over 24h Inform took over 48h and no Follow up

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Now part 3 suggest interpretations For example in Case 2 maybe the loan officer made a mistake in the sequence leading to the order violation and other errors Case3s Credit Check delay might be due to backlogs or system issues Case1s missing Follow up is just a best practice
